name: RecipeHelper
description: The RecipeHelper class provides a powerful interface for interacting with Minecraft crafting recipes in JSMacros scripts. It allows you to examine recipe details, check craftability, get ingredients and outputs, and even automate the crafting process.
overview: RecipeHelper wraps around Minecraft's internal RecipeEntry system and exposes recipe information in a script-friendly format. This class is essential for any scripts that need to work with crafting, recipe management, or automated crafting systems.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Gets the recipe's unique identifier in the format namespace:path.
examples:
const recipeId = recipe.getId();
Chat.log("Recipe ID:", recipeId); // e.g., "minecraft:stick"

methods.name: getIngredients
methods.description: Returns the ingredients required for this recipe. Each ingredient slot contains a list of possible items that can be used for that slot (accounting for tags and alternative items).

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Gets the output item that will be produced when crafting this recipe.

methods.name: craft
methods.description: Executes the crafting recipe. This method requires that the appropriate crafting screen is still open.

parameters.name: craftAll
parameters.description: If true, crafts as many items as possible. If false, crafts one set.

methods.name: getGroup
methods.description: Gets the group this recipe belongs to. Groups are used to organize similar recipes in the recipe book.

methods.name: hasRecipeRemainders
methods.description: Checks if any ingredient in this recipe has a remainder item (like buckets retaining their empty form after crafting).

methods.name: getRecipeRemainders
methods.description: Returns all possible remainder items for ingredients that have recipe remainders.

methods.name: getType
canCraft
methods.description: Checks if the player has sufficient materials to craft at least one set of this recipe.

methods.name: canCraft
methods.description: Checks if the player has sufficient materials to craft the specified number of recipe sets.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The number of recipe sets to check for

methods.name: getCraftableAmount
methods.description: Calculates how many complete sets of the recipe can be crafted with the player's current inventory.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a formatted string representation of the recipe containing its ID.
